resources.string: Import a picture from your device as your canvas.
Click on the image if you want to pick another one.
Choose title & format for your masterpiece!
A tip to make things easier for you
Whenever you see a button or tool whose purpose is not clear, long-press on it. A tip explaining its function will appear on your screen. \n\nHave fun!
Tip: Use two fingers to rotate, or zoom in/out of the canvas. \nTwo-finger double click resizes the canvas to fit the screen. \nTriple-finger single click resets canvas to original size.
Undo Button / /Press this button to undo an action, if possible.
Redo Button / /Press this button to redo an action, if possible.

Tool Button /Determines what is drawn on the canvas. /Tools: 
• Brush: Draw freehand, following your finger gestures 
• Eraser: Set drawn pixels transparent 
• Bucket: Draw an enclosed area with a solid color 
• Eyedropper: Pick a color from the canvas 
• Shape: Draw lines, squares, circles, polygons, and more 
• Text: Draw text on the canvas

Layer List /Your canvas consists of a list of layers, stacked on each other. The left-most layer in the list is considered the top layer. /Functions: 
• Change their hierarchy, by long-pressing and rearranging them in the list 
• Set a layer visible or hidden 
• Add a new layer 
• Merge two or more layers together 
• Duplicate one or more layers 
• Change opacity of one or more layers 
• Clear one or more layers 
• Delete one or more layers 

Tip: Double tapping on a layer brings it to the front, and deselects all selected layers.
Canvas Options / /• Transform your canvas \n•Save canvas as a file in the app\'s local directory \n• Settings

Brush Color / /Pick a color using the ARGB format, or just by using the three color bars that determine the Hue, the brightness and saturation, and lastly the color\'s opacity. \nThe top-left square is a preview of your new color. Click on it when you have found the your color choice.
Brush Size /Determine the width of your brush /The size can range from 1 to 100 pixels.
Brush Type / /• The first type is the traditional brush. \n• Next is the pencil, used for details, always with the width of 1 pixel. \n• Lastly, there is a number of patterns with which you can draw.

Bucket Color / /Pick a color using the ARGB format, or just by using the three color bars that determine the Hue, the brightness and saturation, and lastly the color\'s opacity. \n The top-left square is a preview of your new color. Click on it when you have found the your color choice.
Eraser Opacity /Determine the transparency of erased pixels /The opacity can range from 0 (transparent) to 255 (opaque).
Eraser Size /Determine the width of your eraser /The size can range from 1 to 100 pixels
Add layer / /Create a new, transparent layer. Add it to the top of the list.

Shape Color / /Pick a color using the ARGB format, or just by using the three color bars that determine the Hue, the brightness and saturation, and lastly the color\'s opacity. \n The top-left square is a preview of your new color. Click on it when you have found the your color choice.
Stroke Size /Determine the width of your shapes\' edges /The size can range from 1 to 100 pixels.

Shape type / /You can draw: 
• Line 
• Square 
• Rectangle 
• Circle 
• Oval 
• Polygon
Shape Fill / /Choose between drawing your shapes filled or just their edges.

Text Color / /Pick a color using the ARGB format, or just by using the three color bars that determine the Hue, the brightness and saturation, and lastly the color\'s opacity. \n The top-left square is a preview of your new color. Click on it when you have found the your color choice.
Font Size /Determine the height of your text in pixels /The height can range from 1 to 100 pixels.
Choose Font / /Choose between some default fonts for your text tool.
Toggle Bold / /Choose whether your text tool is in bold.
Toggle Italics / /Choose whether your text tool is in italics.
Flip Horizontally / /Note that the flipping occurs on the top layer only.
Flip Vertically / /Note that the flipping occurs on the top layer only.
